intro: Rehmannia chanetii, commonly known as the Chinese foxglove, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Rehmannia chanetii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional Chinese medicine.
